events.name: SW_INCR
events.description: Software increment. The register is incremented only on writes to the Software Increment Register (PMSWINC)

events.name: L1I_CACHE_REFILL
events.description: L1 instruction cache refill

events.name: L1D_CACHE_REFILL
events.description: L1 data cache refill

events.name: L1D_CACHE
events.description: L1 data cache access

events.name: LD_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, condition check pass - load

events.name: ST_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, condition check pass - store

events.name: INST_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed

events.name: EXC_TAKEN
events.description: Exception taken

events.name: EXC_RETURN
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, condition code check pass, exception return

events.name: CID_WRITE_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, condition code check pass, write to CONTEXTIDR

events.name: PC_WRITE_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, condition check pass, software change of the PC

events.name: BR_IMMED_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, immediate branch

events.name: BR_RETURN_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, condition code check pass, procedure return

events.name: UNALIGNED_LDST_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, condition code check pass, unaligned load or store

events.name: BR_MIS_PRED
events.description: Mispredicted or not predicted branch speculatively executed

events.name: CPU_CYCLES
events.description: Cycle

events.name: BR_PRED
events.description: Predictable branch speculatively executed

events.name: MEM_ACCESS
events.description: Data memory access

events.name: L1I_CACHE
events.description: L1 instruction cache access

events.name: BUS_ACCESS
events.description: AXIM, Flash, or LLPP bus access

events.name: MEMORY_ERROR
events.description: Local memory error (instruction cache, data cache, ATCM, BTCM, CTCM, or Flash)

events.name: INST_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed

events.name: BUS_CYCLES
events.description: Bus cycle (AXIM)

events.name: CHAIN
events.description: For odd-numbered counters, increments the count by one for each overflow of the preceding even-numbered counter. For evennumbered counters, there is no increment

events.name: BR_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, branch

events.name: BR_MIS_PRED_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, mispredicted branch

events.name: STALL_FRONTEND
events.description: No operation issued due to the front end

events.name: STALL_BACKEND
events.description: No operation issued due to the back end

events.name: BUS_ACCESS_RD
events.description: Bus access - Read (AXIM, Flash, or LLPP)

events.name: BUS_ACCESS_WR
events.description: Bus access - Write (AXIM, Flash, or LLPP)

events.name: EXC_SVC
events.description: Exception taken, supervisor call

events.name: EXC_IRQ
events.description: Exception taken, IRQ

events.name: EXC_FIQ
events.description: Exception taken, FIQ

events.name: EXC_HVC
events.description: Exception taken, Hypervisor Call

events.name: EXC_TRAP_IRQ
events.description: Exception taken, IRQ not taken locally

events.name: EXC_TRAP_FIQ
events.description: Exception taken, FIQ not taken locally

events.name: KITE_AXI_READ
events.description: External memory request, AXIM read

events.name: KITE_AXI_WRITE
events.description: External memory request, AXIM write

events.name: KITE_FLASH_READ
events.description: External memory request, Flash (read-only)

events.name: KITE_LLPP_READ
events.description: External memory request, LLPP read

events.name: KITE_LLPP_WRITE
events.description: External memory request, LLPP write

events.name: KITE_NC_AXI_READ
events.description: Non-cacheable external memory request, AXIM read

events.name: KITE_NC_AXI_WRITE
events.description: Non-cacheable external memory request, AXIM write

events.name: KITE_NC_FLASH_READ
events.description: Non-cacheable external memory request, Flash (read-only)

events.name: KITE_REFILL_PF_AXI
events.description: L1 data cache refill because of prefetch (AXIM only)

events.name: KITE_REFILL_LS_AXI
events.description: L1 data cache refill because of load or store, AXIM

events.name: KITE_REFILL_LS_FLASH
events.description: L1 data cache refill because of load or store, Flash.bx

events.name: KITE_DC_ACCESS_AXI
events.description: L1 data cache access in a way reserved for AXIM

events.name: KITE_DC_ACCESS_FLASH
events.description: L1 data cache access in a way reserved for Flash.by

events.name: KITE_IC_ACCESS_AXI
events.description: L1 instruction cache access in a way reserved for AXIM

events.name: KITE_IC_ACCESS_FLASH
events.description: L1 instruction cache access in a way reserved for Flash.bz

events.name: KITE_NC_LS_HINTED_AXI
events.description: Non-cacheable external memory request because of load was hinted, AXIM.ca

events.name: KITE_NC_LS_HINTED_FLASH_READ
events.description: Non-cacheable external memory request because of load was hinted, Flash.ca

events.name: KITE_REFILL_IC_AXI
events.description: L1 Instruction cache refill, AXIM

events.name: KITE_REFILL_IC_FLASH
events.description: L1 Instruction cache refill, Flash.cb

events.name: KITE_NC_LS_AXI_READ
events.description: Non-cacheable external memory request because of load, AXIM

events.name: KITE_NC_LS_FLASH_READ
events.description: Non-cacheable external memory request because of load, Flash

events.name: KITE_COND_BR_RETIRED
events.description: Conditional branch executed

events.name: KITE_MIS_PRED_COND_BR
events.description: Conditional branch mispredicted

events.name: KITE_BTAC_BR_RETIRED
events.description: BTAC branch executed

events.name: KITE_MIS_PRED_BTAC_BR
events.description: Conditional branch mispredicted

events.name: KITE_VSCTLR_CHANGED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, MCR to VSCTLR

events.name: KITE_DSB_ALL_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, strong DSB, DFB

events.name: KITE_SIMULT_ACCESS_AXI
events.description: Simultaneous accesses from instruction side and data side to AXIM (causing contention)

events.name: KITE_SIMULT_ACCESS_FLASH
events.description: Simultaneous accesses from instruction side and data side to Flash (causing contention)

events.name: KITE_EL2_ENTERED
events.description: Exception taken to EL2 (hyp mode entry), excluding reset

events.name: KITE_CRS_BR_RETIRED
events.description: Implementation defined event. CRS branch executed

events.name: KITE_MIS_PRED_CRS_BR
events.description: CRS branch mispredicted

events.name: KITE_COR_ERR_MEM
events.description: Correctable memory error occurred from any source (L1 instruction cache, L1 data cache, ATCM, BTCM, CTCM, or flash)

events.name: KITE_FAT_ERR_MEM
events.description: Fatal memory error occurred from any source (ATCM, BTCM, CTCM, or Flash)

events.name: KITE_BUS_COR_DATA
events.description: Correctable data payload bus error occurred from any source (AXIM or LLPP)

events.name: KITE_BUS_FAT_OTHER
events.description: Fatal non-protocol bus error (payload errors, except data) occurred from any source (AXIM, Flash, or LLPP)

events.name: KITE_BUS_PROTOCOL_ANY
events.description: Fatal protocol bus error (LEN, ID, LAST, READY, and interconnect protection errors) occurred from any source (AXIM, Flash, or LLPP)

events.name: KITE_IQ_EMPTY_NO_MISS
events.description: Counts every cycle that the DPU IQ is empty and that is not because of a recent instruction cache miss in any cache way

events.name: KITE_IQ_EMPTY_AXI_MISS
events.description: Counts every cycle that the DPU IQ is empty and there is an instruction cache miss being processed for a cache way reserved for AXI Master

events.name: KITE_IQ_EMPTY_FLASH_MISS
events.description: Counts every cycle that the DPU IQ is empty and there is an instruction cache miss being processed for a cache way reserved for Flash

events.name: KITE_INTERLOCK_OTHER
events.description: Counts every cycle there is an interlock that is not because of an Advanced SIMD or floating-point instruction, and not because of a load/store instruction waiting for data to calculate the address in the AGU. Stall cycles because of a stall in Wr, typically awaiting load data, are excluded

events.name: KITE_INTERLOCK_AGU
events.description: Counts every cycle there is an interlock that is because of a load/ store instruction waiting for data to calculate the address in the AGU. Stall cycles because of a stall in Wr, typically awaiting load data, are excluded

events.name: KITE_INTERLOCK_FPASIMD
events.description: Counts every cycle there is an interlock that is because of an Advanced SIMD or floating-point instruction. Stall cycles because of a stall in the Wr stage, typically waiting load data, are excluded

events.name: KITE_LOAD_STALL_AXI
events.description: Counts every cycle there is a stall in the Wr stage because of a load miss from the AXIM

events.name: KITE_LOAD_STALL_FLASH
events.description: Counts every cycle there is a stall in the Wr stage because of a load miss from Flash

events.name: KITE_WR_STALL_STORE
events.description: Counts every cycle there is a stall in the Wr stage because of a store

events.name: KITE_WR_STALL_AXI_STB_FULL
events.description: Store stalled because the AXIM part of the store buffer was full

events.name: KITE_WR_STALL_TCM_STB_FULL
events.description: Store stalled because the TCM part of the store buffer was full

events.name: KITE_WR_STALL_LLPP_STB_FULL
events.description: Store stalled because the LLPP part of the store buffer was full

events.name: KITE_BARRIER_STALL_BARRIER
events.description: Barrier stalled because store buffer was busy with another barrier

events.name: KITE_BARRIER_STORE_AXIWRITE
events.description: Barrier stalled because it was waiting for a write to complete on the AXIM bus

events.name: KITE_IC_WT_HIT
events.description: L1 instruction cache way tracker hit

events.name: KITE_DC_WT_HIT
events.description: L1 data cache way tracker hit

events.name: KITE_I_UMPU_HIT
events.description: Instruction side micro MPU hit

events.name: KITE_D_UMPU_HIT
events.description: Data side micro MPU hit. This can also be counted on a pipeline stall

events.name: KITE_IC_CACHE_HIT
events.description: L1 instruction cache hit

events.name: KITE_IC_LFB_HIT
events.description: L1 instruction cache linefill buffer hit

events.name: KITE_IC_BIU_HIT
events.description: L1 instruction cache hit on BIU response

events.name: KITE_IC_HINT_REQ
events.description: L1 instruction cache hint request sent
Two instructions architecturally executed in parallel. Asserted along with bit PMUEVENTx[5] when dual issuing
Fatal data payload bus error occurred from any source (AXIM or LLPP)
Fatal READY signal bus error occurred from any source (AXIM, Flash, or LLPP)
Correctable L1 instruction cache (data or tag) memory error
Correctable L1 data cache (data or tag) memory error
Correctable ATCM, BTCM, or CTCM memory error
Fatal ATCM, BTCM, or CTCM memory error
Correctable flash memory error
Fatal flash memory error
Timeout for AXIM bus
Timeout for Flash bus
Timeout for LLPP bus

Correctable memory occurred from any source (L1 instruction cache, L1 data cache, ATCM, BTCM, CTCM, or Flash) but was not recorded the ERRs because they were full or because it was overwritten by a fatal error
Fatal memory error occurred from any source (L1 instruction cache, L1 data cache, ATCM, BTCM, CTCM, or Flash) but was not recorded in the ERRs because they were full
Interrupts masked in Hyp mode for too long (the IMP_INTMONR watchdog has triggered)
A memory or bus fatal error was synchronously detected in Hyp mode
An abort exception was taken because an EL2-controlled MPU fault generated an abort
An abort exception was taken because an EL1-controlled MPU fault generated an abort
An Undefined exception was taken due to any cause
A memory access marked in EL1- controlled MPU as Device was flushed because it was marked as Normal in EL2-controlled MPU
Processor livelock because of hard errors or exception at exception vector. This is a pulse bit. An exception of the same type and vector offset was consecutively taken 20 times
Software running in EL2 unlocks TESTR1. TESTR1 is for testing purposes only
